intro: Croton campestris var. atratus, commonly known as the Black Croton, is a striking plant characterized by its dark, almost black foliage. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features glossy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically deep green to black in color. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by unique, spiny seed capsules. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its bold and dramatic appearance.
